answers.answer: I'm overweight and pregnant, that's all I worried about was health issues for my child. Even though some chances of health issues can increase when being overweight and pregnant. You can defiantly have a healthy pregnancy just like other women. Society makes it worse by saying rude things like "oh your baby is gonna be huge" "aren't you scared you might have to have a c section" "i bet you have high blood pressure" and you'll get dirty stares when u tell someone you're pregnant "you don't look pregnant" well duh lol but ignore it you chance are you'll be fine
I have been over weight before pregnancy and now I gain more and moreI also worry just about my babies
I'm overweight and currently 40+2. My pregnancy has been amazing. I have had absolutely no complications, as well, I have had barely any morning sickness and I generally feel great.

Don't stress yourself out hun, it will do more harm than good. Just make healthy choices during your pregnancy, Skinny Cow Ice Creams and Chocolates have been a life saver for me because I have such a big sweet tooth at night. You can use calorie trackers such as MyFitnessPal, which has an app with QR code scanner, to track your nutrition. I'm not saying you have to go on a salad binge or anything,  just be conscious of serving sizes and always go for homemade over store bought or take out. I am slighly overweight and was concerned about gestational diabetes,  but I have tried to make these little changes to my diet and go on short walks every day and am happy to say that I have had a great pregnancy! Only two months left! Talk with your OB about your concerns because although there is risk with being overweight and pregnant, you can make subtle changes that will have a enormous impact on your pregnancy and the well being of your baby♡

Im considered overweight and the hospital counseler came to talk to me amd told me since im over weight my baby can be huge and all this and im not even big im a size 10 but my dr was so upset at my weight and told me to lose 20lbs . But iswitched drs n my new one said my weight gain was fine anf not to worry about it

I'm overweight, I gained 30 lbs before I was pregnant and another 30 since. I'm 28+7 and am definitely slowing down my weight gain, I'm making healthy choices and limiting sweets and bad things. I need to walk and exercise more but everything has been great. I had a scare with gestational diabetes but do not have it. Thankfully. Just make healthy choices and you'll be okay :)
Aww thanks lady's, you made me feel little better! Iam little overweight And I'm so worried about this pregnancy!

I am overweight and lost quite a bit of weight and as my son grows i continue to lose weight so my when my obgyn weighs me it comes up the same. I am not worried about my son's health because my ob always lets me know if my son is doing well or not. So far my entire pregnancy may son has been healthy. I am 25 weeks

question: Is anyone in same issue??? I'd anyone scarred on being pregnant and worried about health problems
title: overweight and pregnant
